channel.title: Link-Rot
channel.description: A weekly discussion about whats happening in life, technology and the way they intersect and interact. At the moment we're just testing the format and hoping to iron out issues in the coming weeks. We'd appreciate your feedback!
channel.itunes:subtitle: A weekly discussion about whats happening in life, technology and the way they intersect and interact. At the moment we're just testing the format and hoping to iron out issues in the coming weeks. We'd appreciate your feedback!
channel.itunes:author: Tim Klapdor
channel.itunes:summary: A weekly discussion about whats happening in life, technology and the way they intersect and interact. At the moment we're just testing the format and hoping to iron out issues in the coming weeks. We'd appreciate your feedback!

item.title: Will Netflix kill TV?
item.description: Episode and we ask the question - will Netflix kill TV?
item.itunes:author: Tim Klapdor
item.itunes:subtitle: Link-Rot: Will Netflix kill TV?
item.itunes:summary: The power of TV has been dwindling over recent years. So will the experience of Netflix kill off TV?

item.title: The Physicality of Stuff
item.description: Episode 2 and we asking what happens when physical stuff is replaced by the digital.
item.itunes:author: Tim Klapdor
item.itunes:subtitle: Link-Rot: The Physicality of Stuff
item.itunes:summary: More and more of our lives are becoming digitised - digital objects without a physical equivalent or presence. What kind of effect does this have on us - our identity and how we navigate our history?

item.title: Boring iPhones & Digital Death
item.description: Our first episode and we tackle just how boring new technology is and what death looks like in the digital age.
item.itunes:author: Tim Klapdor
item.itunes:subtitle: Link-Rot: Boring iPhones & Digital Death
item.itunes:summary: Join Tim, Ben and Adam for this, the first episode, as we discuss some of the things passing us by at the intersection of life and technology.
